etymologies: mid 17th century: from Latin, neuter (used as a noun) of pendulus ‘hanging down’

definitions: a weight hung from a fixed point so that it can swing freely backward and forward, especially a rod with a weight at the end that regulates the mechanism of a clock.
shortDefinitions: weight hung from fixed point so that it can swing freely

definitions: used to refer to the tendency of a situation to oscillate between one extreme and another
shortDefinitions: used to refer to tendency of situation to oscillate between one extreme and another
